result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory K. Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AODA and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent
DNA sample

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory K. Meyer

defendant.name: Meyer, Gregory K.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory K. Meyer in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:13 am.  State gives plea agreement, plea to ct 1, ct 2 DRI, withheld sentence 1 year probation, AODA, Restitution 28.48, Copps, no jail, cost only, DNA Sample & surcharge.  Parties agree to plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights form filed.  Def. understands form.  Ct 1 Retail Theft, 943.50(1m)(d), no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT rights. Ct. 2 DRI,  Def. understands elements. Atty Schuster is satisfied. Court accepts plea & finds freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Retail Theft, 943.50(1m)(d).  State gives sentencing statement. Atty Schuster gives sentencing argument. Def. makes statement. Court accepts agreement & orders 
withheld jail sentence, 1 year probation, AODA & counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, Restitution $28.48 to Copps, court costs & DNA Sample & $200 surcharge. 1 day credit if revoked.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schuster has authorization to appear.  Complaint received, reviewed.  Authorization filed.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept plea.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:51 pm. Atty Schuster request an adjournment, def. is Oneida Co. Jail. State does not object.  Court grants.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Bond remains.
